page.title: 07HANWORTH AIR PARK
page.content: Hanworth was the first airport to be used in Middlesex. It only had grass for the runway and it wasn't just used for airplanes instead Autogyro's and Air Ships (including the famous R101) landed there. During the Second World War they built Fairey Fireflys,Hamicar Gliders and many other planes in the hastily constructed hangers/factories. Spitfire planes also flew in to have bomb racks fitted onto their wings. At present the Air Park is used by the public for recreational purposes such as football and rugby.Part of our school fields are also on the Air Park as is the local swimming baths aud squash courts. There are still some of the hangers left today as a reminder of recent past.
